results.title: Meet the Newer, Bolder Michelle Williams
results.abstract: With “The Fabelmans,” the Oscar-nominated actress moves from minor-key naturalism to more stylized performances: “I wanted to make work that an audience member had to deal with.”

multimedia.caption: “I’ve been working as hard as I know how to make myself ready for a moment when I would meet a role like this,” Michelle Williams said of her performance as Mitzi in “The Fabelmans.”
multimedia.copyright: Sinna Nasseri for The New York Times

results.title: Raúl Castillo Can Empathize With Ambivalence
results.abstract: In “The Inspection,” he plays a drill instructor who takes a bullied recruit under his wing, the kind of nurturing the actor says he has benefited from as well.

multimedia.caption: Raúl Castillo in “The Inspection” as Rosales, a character he describes as “someone who looks out for an underdog.”

results.title: When the Camera Can’t Turn Away, These Women Force Us to Listen
results.abstract: Films as different as the biopic “Till” and the thriller “Resurrection” use lengthy monologues to give female characters the chance to truly be heard.

results.title: Lashana Lynch Challenges the ‘Strong Black Woman’ Cliché, Softly
results.abstract: She plays a ferocious warrior in “The Woman King,” but in her performance, vulnerability and humanity were what she sought to convey.

multimedia.caption: Taking on the role of Izogie in “The Woman King,” Lashana Lynch said, “I thought, ‘I want her masculine and feminine energy to be equally as powerful and equally as seen.’”
Taking on the role of Izogie in “The Woman King,” Lashana Lynch said, “I thought, ‘I want her masculine and feminine energy to be equally as powerful and equally as seen.’”

results.title: One Indelible Scene: The Master Class in Ambiguity in ‘Tár’
results.abstract: Cate Blanchett’s character visits Juilliard to tackle the big questions about art, life and music-world rivalry.

results.title: One Indelible Scene: A Donkey’s Escape in ‘EO’
results.abstract: The animal, reared in a circus, enters into a forest and a world of wild animals. For the first and only time in the movie, he is free.

results.title: Teen Stars of ‘Romeo and Juliet’ Sue Over Nudity in 1968 Film
results.abstract: Olivia Hussey and Leonard Whiting assert in a lawsuit that Paramount Pictures should have known nude images of them in their teens were “secretly and unlawfully obtained.”

multimedia.caption: Olivia Hussey and Leonard Whiting in the 1968 film “Romeo and Juliet.”

results.title: For ‘Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio,’ a Star Built From Tiny Gears and 3-D Printing
results.abstract: The studio behind stop-motion hits like ‘Corpse Bride’ and ‘Fantastic Mr. Fox’ started work on the new film in 2008 but had to wait for the technology to catch up.

multimedia.caption: Most of the stop-motion puppets in “Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio” are operated through mechanical gears in their heads. But the title character was fabricated via metal 3-D printing.
Most of the stop-motion puppets in “Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio” are operated through mechanical gears in their heads. But the title character was fabricated via metal 3-D printing.
Most of the stop-motion puppets in “Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio” are operated through mechanical gears in their heads. But the title character was fabricated via metal 3-D printing.

results.title: Diego Calva and the Detour That Took Him to ‘Babylon’
results.abstract: The star of Damien Chazelle’s epic was set on becoming a writer-director. Even after landing a part in an indie film, he wasn’t sold on acting. Then Hollywood called.

multimedia.caption: “My first day on a Hollywood set was also the character’s first day on a Hollywood set,” Diego Calva said. “All of the expressions of surprise you see on my face are real.”
multimedia.copyright: Carlos Jaramillo for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Avatar’ and the Headache of High Frame Rate Filmmaking
results.abstract: Why do James Cameron and others experiment with this? Intended to eliminate blur, it is actually unnerving in scenes involving humans or real objects.

multimedia.caption: Jack Champion as Spider in “Avatar: The Way of Water.” The higher frame rate used in some shots can make actors look hyper-real.
Jack Champion as Spider in “Avatar: The Way of Water.” The higher frame rate used in some shots can make actors look hyper-real.
Jack Champion as Spider in “Avatar: The Way of Water.” The higher frame rate used in some shots can make actors look hyper-real.

results.title: To Buff a Balkan Leader’s Image, a Filmmaker Calls In Kevin Spacey
results.abstract: A director cast the beleaguered actor as Franjo Tudjman, the late Croatian leader, whom some call a patriot and others revile as an ethnonationalist zealot.
des_facet: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
Once Upon a Time in Croatia (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Croatia’s first president, Franjo Tudjman, was described by one historian as “one of the more egregiously unattractive” leaders to emerge in the breakup of Yugoslavia.
Croatia’s first president, Franjo Tudjman, was described by one historian as “one of the more egregiously unattractive” leaders to emerge in the breakup of Yugoslavia.

results.title: Wes Bentley Was at Rock Bottom. Now He Is on ‘Yellowstone.’
results.abstract: Years of addiction and struggle followed his breakout role in “American Beauty.” He lived to tell the tale, and get a major role on TV’s biggest show.

multimedia.caption: “I’ve prided myself for most of my career on leaving it at the door,” Wes Bentley said of his challenging role as Jamie Dutton on “Yellowstone.” “But Jamie’s sadness permeates my life.”
multimedia.copyright: Peter Fisher for The New York Times
